cmCourseInfo.description: Introduction to financial mathematics, interest measurement, present value calculation, annuity valuation, loan amortization, consumer financing arrangements, bond valuation. The course is aimed at a general audience who will not be continuing in the actuarial science program.
cmCourseInfo.title: Mathematics of Finance for Non-Actuaries

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

cmCourseInfo.description: Interest, discount and present values, as applied to determine prices and values of annuities, mortgages, bonds, equities; loan repayment schedules and consumer finance payments in general; yield rates on investments given the costs on investments.
cmCourseInfo.title: Mathematics of Investment & Credit

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

courses.name: Financial Principles for Actuarial Science I

cmCourseInfo.description: Term structure of interest rates, cashflow duration, convexity and immunization, forward and futures contracts, interest rate swaps, introduction to investment derivatives and hedging strategies.
cmCourseInfo.title: Financial Principles for Actuarial Science I

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

cmCourseInfo.description: Probability theory applied to survival and to costs and risks of life assurances, life annuities, and pensions; analysis of survival distributions; international actuarial notation.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introductory Life Contingencies

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

cmCourseInfo.description: Determination of benefit premium and benefit reserves for life insurance and annuities; analysis of insurance loss random variables; theory of life contingencies for multiple lives.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Life Contingencies
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: ACT240H1 (minimum grade C); ACT245H1 (minimum grade C); ACT247H1 (minimum grade C); (STA257H1,STA261H1); MAT237Y1/MAT257Y1

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

cmCourseInfo.description: Actuarial applications of financial mathematics and economics.
cmCourseInfo.title: Corporate Finance for Actuarial Science
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: ACT240H1 (minimum grade C); ACT245H1 (minimum grade C); ACT247H1 (minimum grade C); (STA257H1, STA261H1); MAT237Y1/MAT257Y1

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

courses.name: Financial Principles for Actuarial Science II

cmCourseInfo.description: Mathematical theory of financial derivatives, discrete and continuous option pricing models, hedging strategies and exotic option valuation.
cmCourseInfo.title: Financial Principles for Actuarial Science II
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: ACT240H1 (minimum grade C); ACT245H1 (minimum grade C); ACT247H1 (minimum grade C); (STA257H1,STA261H1); MAT237Y1/MAT257Y1

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

courses.name: Basic Reserving Methods For P&C Insurance

cmCourseInfo.description: Topics covered include resrving data and triangles, diagnoses methods that range from triangle of ratios of paid claims to reported claims to triangel of reported claim ratios. The sylloabus also includes projection techniques.
cmCourseInfo.title: Basic Reserving Methods For P&C Insurance

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

courses.name: Basic Ratemaking Methods For P&C Insurance

cmCourseInfo.description: This course covers the basic ratemaking methods for P&C insurance. It assumes that students are familiar with traditional reserving diagnoses and projection methods. The syllabus would introduce concepts related to earning of exposures, on-level factors, catastrophe loading, large loss loading and credibility.
cmCourseInfo.title: Basic Ratemaking Methods For P&C Insurance

cmCourseInfo.description: Loss models policy adjustments, frequency and severity models, compound distributions.
cmCourseInfo.title: Loss Models
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: STA261H1, ACT348H1, STA347H1 (ACT348H1, STA347H1 can be corequisite with permission of instructor)

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

cmCourseInfo.description: Estimation of Loss and Survival Models using complete, censored and truncated data. Product-Limit estimation, empirical estimation, moment and percentile estimation, maximum likelihood estimation and simulation models.
cmCourseInfo.title: Loss Models II

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

cmCourseInfo.description: Advanced life contingencies, multiple decrement theory, insurance policy expenses, multi-state transition models, Poisson processes.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Topics in Actuarial Science

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

cmCourseInfo.description: Applications of the lognormal distribution, Brownian motion, geometric Brownian motion, martingales, Itos limma, stochastic differential equations, interest rate models, the Black-Scholes model, volatility, value at risk, conditional tail expectation.
cmCourseInfo.title: Stochastic Methods for Actuarial Science

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

cmCourseInfo.description: Limited fluctuation credibility, Bayesian estimation, Buhlmann credibility, non-parametric credibility methods, inverse transformation simulation method, specialized simulation methods for the normal and lognormal distributions, Monte Carlo methods, the bootstrap method.
cmCourseInfo.title: Credibility and Simulation

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

cmCourseInfo.description: Topics in pension mathematics; funding methods for pension plans. (Offered in alternate years)
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Pension Mathematics

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

cmCourseInfo.description: Topic for 2016-2017: Advanced Ratemaking Methods for P&C Insurance This course will cover advanced ratemaking methods for P&C insurance. It includes topics such as commercial insurance pricing, catastrophic pricing, reinsurance pricing and GLM aplications to P&C insurance. (Offered in alternate years)
cmCourseInfo.title: Topics in Casualty Actuarial Science

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
For AE courses, enrolment is done via ACORN. Students must check back for their status update. If you have any questions, please contact Gillis Aning at the Department of Statistical Sciences, Sidney Smith Hall, 100 St. George St., Room 6018, gillis.aning@utoronto.ca or 416-978-5041.

cmCourseInfo.description: Case study approach to current issues in life insurance, pension consulting and casualty actuarial practice. The focus of the course will be on communication and presentation. This course is Pass/Fail. Not eligibile for Credit/No Credit. The course is open to students in the specialist program in actuarial science. Students in the major program in actuarial science can enrol into the course with permission of the department.
cmCourseInfo.title: Issues In Actuarial Practice

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

courses.name: Insurance Products and Regulation with AXIS

cmCourseInfo.description: Examine key types of insurance products and their pricing and valuation. Review representative developments in insurance regulations in US, Europe and Canada. Demonstrate case studies using leading actuarial application AXIS.
cmCourseInfo.title: Insurance Products and Regulation with AXIS

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

cmCourseInfo.description: Independent study under the direction of a faculty member. Persons wishing to take this course must have the permission of the Undergraduate Secretary and of the prospective supervisor. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Readings in Actuarial Science

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes
